bibl.title: Letter from Robert Usher to Philip Showalter Hench, November 21, 1941

div1.p: Usher thanks Hench for the reprint of his yellow fever article and informs Hench that he will check for references to yellow fever in New Orleans.

div1.head: Letter from Robert Usher to Philip Showalter Hench, November 21, 1941
div1.opener:
The Howard-Tilton Memorial Library
The Tulane University of Louisiana
New Orleans
November 21, 1941
ROBERT J. USHER,
LIBRARIAN
RALPH W. McCOMB.
ASSISTANT LIBRARIAN
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you for your reprint “Conquerors of
Yellow Fever” which we are very glad to have. I will
ask our reference librarian and also Miss Marshall, librarian
of the medical library if they can suggest any references
that illustrate the human, rather than the scientific, side
of the yellow fever epidemics in New Orleans.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, R. J Usher
Librarian RJU:EB
cc: Miss Marshall
